entries.meaning: A person with an extraordinary intellect or skill that is markedly superior to his or her peers.
examples: At long intervals some master-minds appeared, looking upon each advance in practical science as a retro-gradation in the true utility.

entries.meaning: A person responsible for the highest level of planning and execution of a major operation.

verbs.description: mastermind (third-person singular simple present masterminds, present participle masterminding, simple past and past participle masterminded)

entries.meaning: To act in the role of mastermind.
